c74object.name: jcom.dbap
c74object.description: DBAP is a amplitude based spatialisation technique that can be used with irregular loudspeakers. It do not assume the loudspeakers to be in a regular array or circle surrounding the listener, and neither is it optimized for a particular listening position (sweet spot).

method.name: blur
method.description:
The spatial bluriness of each source can be controlled by the message blur with two arguments: the source instance number (int) and the blur factor to use (float). The blur factor is related to the size of the space spanned by the destination points, with the intent that it is supposed to perceptually work similarly when moved from one layout to another.
When the distance from source to destination is calculated as part of the DBAP algorithm, a radius r is introduced as an extra dimension in the calculation:
distance = sqrt(Δx*Δx+Δy*Δy+r*r) where r = blur*v .
v is the variance of mean distance from destination points to the the mean position of the destination space. The larger blur is, the more evenly the signal is distributed to all positions, resulting in a more diffuse localisation.

method.name: blurall
method.description: The blurall message with a float argument can be used to set blur factor for all sources.

method.name: dst_position
method.description: The message dst_position can be used to set the position of one destination point. An int argument sets the instance number, and is followed by one to three float values setting the position, according to the current number of dimensions.

method.name: info
method.description: The message info cause jcom.dbap to output information concerning current positions of sources and destinations.

method.name: src_position
method.description: The message src_position can be used to set the position of one source point. An int argument sets the instance number, and is followed by one to three float values setting the position, according to the current number of dimensions.

attribute.name: dimensions
attribute.digest: The number of dimensions of the geometric space. Possible values are 1, 2 or 3.
attribute.description: The number of dimensions of the geometric space. Possible values are 1, 2 or 3.

attribute.name: num_destinations
attribute.digest: The number of destination points that incoming signals will be panned to.
attribute.description: The number of destination points that incoming signals will be panned to.

attribute.name: num_sourcec
attribute.digest: The number of source points that will be dynamically panned.
attribute.description: The number of source points that will be dynamically panned.

attribute.name: rolloff
attribute.digest: The relative roll-of of amplitude with increasing distance from a destination point, expressed in dB.
attribute.description: The relative roll-of of amplitude with increasing distance from a destination point, expressed in dB. Default value is 6 dB. The higher tre rolloff, the more the sources will tend to to be attracted towards the closest destination(s). High values can be used for synthetic spatialisation effects where sources are attracted to one destination at a time, with non-dicontinuous transitions from one destination to the next.

seealsolist.seealso: GUI interface for visualization and control of positions.

entry.name: list
entry.description: Out left outlet: When source position, destinastion positions or other relevant parameters are changed, a series of lists are output on the form source_ID (int) destination_ID (int) amplitude (float). The lists should be passed to the leftmost inlet of a matrix~ object.

entry.name: anything
entry.description: Out right outlet: In addition to attribute values, information on positions of sources and destinations can be retrieved with the info message. Information on the state of the object is returned form the rightmost dump outlet, for further routing and processing.
